intro: Gladiolus mutabilis, commonly known as the changing gladiolus, is a striking member of the Iridaceae family native to South Africa. This species is notable for its ability to change flower color as it blooms, starting with white or pale pink and gradually shifting to red or purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring sword-shaped leaves and tall, branched inflorescences. Its flowers are often used in cut flower arrangements due to their vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms. Gladiolus mutabilis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral displays.
